skill.name: uspto-database
skill.description: Access USPTO APIs for patent/trademark searches, examination history (PEDS), assignments, citations, office actions, TSDR, for IP analysis and prior art searches.
skill.summary: Access USPTO APIs for patent/trademark searches, examination history (PEDS), assignments, citations,...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Legitimate skill for accessing USPTO APIs with standard HTTP requests to documented government endpoints. No credential exfiltration, obfuscation, or suspicious network behavior detected.

content.value_statement: Finding patent and trademark information requires navigating multiple USPTO systems. This skill provides unified access to PatentSearch, PEDS, TSDR, and assignment databases for comprehensive IP research.
actual_capabilities: Search patents by keywords, inventor, assignee, classification, or date range
Retrieve trademark status and prosecution history via TSDR API
Access patent examination data and transaction history via PEDS
Track patent and trademark ownership assignments
Monitor trademark portfolio health and alerts
Combine multiple USPTO APIs for comprehensive IP analysis
limitations: Requires free USPTO API key registration at account.uspto.gov
PatentSearch rate limit is 45 requests per minute
Limited to USPTO data only (no EPO, WIPO, or other patent offices)
Some text endpoints (claims, descriptions) are in beta with partial data

use_cases.title: Prior art searches
use_cases.description: Search for existing patents before filing new applications or responding to office actions

use_cases.title: Portfolio monitoring
use_cases.description: Track status of pending applications and monitor trademark health across company brands

use_cases.title: Patent landscape analysis
use_cases.description: Analyze technology trends, citation patterns, and ownership changes in specific fields

prompt_templates.title: Simple patent search
prompt_templates.prompt: Search for patents containing 'machine learning' in the abstract, published in 2024

prompt_templates.title: Trademark lookup
prompt_templates.prompt: Look up trademark serial number 87654321 and report its current status

prompt_templates.title: Examination history
prompt_templates.prompt: Get the examination history and office actions for application 16123456

prompt_templates.title: Ownership tracking
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all assignment records for patent number 11234567 showing ownership transfers

output_examples.input: Search for patents about artificial intelligence filed by Google in 2024
output: All patents assigned to Google LLC with CPC classification G06N

best_practices: Register for a free USPTO API key before using this skill
Cache API responses to stay within rate limits
Use specific search criteria to reduce result set size
anti_patterns: Sharing your USPTO API key in conversations or code
Ignoring rate limits and causing API access issues
Assuming all data fields are populated for every record

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for patent and trademark research workflows.

faq.question: Is the USPTO API free to use?
faq.answer: Yes. USPTO APIs are free but require registration at account.uspto.gov/api-manager/

faq.question: Can I search international patents?
faq.answer: No. This skill only accesses USPTO databases covering US patents and trademarks.

faq.question: How do I combine patent and trademark data?
faq.answer: Use PatentSearch for patents and TSDR for trademarks separately. The skill provides different client methods for each.

faq.question: Is my API key stored securely?
faq.answer: The skill reads your API key from the USPTO_API_KEY environment variable only during execution.

faq.question: How is this different from PatentsView?
faq.answer: PatentSearch replaced the legacy PatentsView API in May 2025. This skill uses the modern ElasticSearch-based system.
